title: Royle Family star Ricky Tomlinson swaps the booze for paintbrushes after discovering love of art
text:
He was the heavy-drinking star of much-loved family sitcom The Royle Family.

But Ricky Tomlinson has swapped booze for paintbrushes after discovering a hidden passion for art.

The actor, 80, revealed he hasn't 'touched a drop of the sauce' for 18 months and has instead lost himself in painting.

A radical change: Ricky Tomlinson, 80, has swapped the beer for paintbrushes by taking up art

Ricky, who was well-known for bringing his own cans of supermarket lager to celebrity functions, told the Sunday Mirror that he gets 'hypnotised' by painting.

'Painting started as a bit of fun and a way to raise a few bob, but now I really do get hypnotised by it,' he said.

'I completely lose myself in painting. I love it. I painted a completely blue square on a blank canvas I bought from the pound shop. I called it Yellow Submarine.

'Some soft sod paid £40 for it and then asked me where the submarine is. I told them it was under the bloody water.

Amateur artist: 'Painting started as a bit of fun and a way to raise a few bob, but now I really do get hypnotised by it' (Pictured: Ricky with his on-screen family members)

The actor, who played patriarch Jim Royle in the show throughout its original run from 1998 to 2000 and in Christmas specials from 2006 to 2012, added he now has a cup of tea to wind down instead of beer.

He joked that he calls himself 'Ricasso' and enjoys dressing up in traditional painting clothes.

The actor has even sold some of his creations to raise money for charities including Ronald McDonald House, Alder Hey Hospital and Claire House children's hospice.

Ricky is set to re-unite with Ralf Little, who plays his son Anthony in The Royle Family, for a six-part show called Ricky And Ralf's Very Northern Road Trip.

The pair will travel across the North of England in a camper van to reminisce and entertain each other.
description: Ricky Tomlinson has swapped booze for paintbrushes after discovering a hidden passion for art.
